data.sentence: The word أُولَئِكَ comes from the root ا و ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word وَاللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to fix, raise/setup/establish. nasiba - to use diligence, toil/labour, be instant.
data.sentence: The word نَصِيبٌ comes from the root ن ص ب and is associated with the meanings: to fix, raise/setup/establish. nasiba - to use diligence, toil/labour, be instant.

data.meanings: To gain, acquire, seek after, gather (riches), do, commit, earn.
data.sentence: The word كَسَبُوا comes from the root ك س ب and is associated with the meanings: To gain, acquire, seek after, gather (riches), do, commit, earn.

data.meanings: to hasten, be quick, swift/prompt/sudden, strive with one another.
data.sentence: The word سَرِيعُ comes from the root س ر ع and is associated with the meanings: to hasten, be quick, swift/prompt/sudden, strive with one another.

data.meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.
data.sentence: The word الْحِسَابِ comes from the root ح س ب and is associated with the meanings: To think, consider, suppose, imagine, be of opinion.
